poem:
Title: "A Betrayal in St Leonard's and Aylesbury"

Pillars of security, seized in sunlit raid,
Deceit in homes where trust was gently laid.
Carlauren whispers fade in Dorset air,
In Buckinghamshire, echoes of despair.
The deep-shadowed halls of the aged, plundered,
By heartless hands, the spirit sundered.
Yet, in the ruins of this grim affray,
Humanity persists, in its quiet way.
